intro: Skinnera antarctica, commonly known as the Antarctic skinnera, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Antarctica. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in the short growing season of the Antarctic summer. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to the extreme environmental conditions of its habitat. Skinnera antarctica plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food for native insects and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
